III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited
to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth A was slammed to the ground by staff during an incident
that occurred on 10/19/2024.
Investigation The Complainant was contacted on 10/28/2024 and had no
additional information to provide.
Youth A was interviewed during an unannounced, face-to-face
visit to the facility on 10/28/2024. Youth A stated he was jumped
by another youth in the hallway outside the pod when staff
intervened and restrained both he and the other youth. Youth A
could not recall which staff were involved in the restraint. Youth A
then recalled he was out in the pod and had his face slammed by
the staff restraining him. He could not provide any other detail on
how this occurred. He was then moved into his room, where he
felt staff press their elbow into his ear, as well as slam his face
into his bed slab. Youth A detailed that there were no other youth
in the room or in his pod at the time. Youth A recalled saying
“stop, stop, stop” to the staff involved. Youth A ended the
interview at this time.
Staff 1 was interviewed over the phone with DHHS Worker 1 on
11/01/2024. Staff 1 discussed the incident in question, stating that
Youth A was escalated while inside the pod and had to be
restrained. Staff 1 recalled never seeing Youth A fall, get
slammed or be physically abused in any other way. Staff 1 heard
Youth A yell repeatedly, “I want to leave.” She recalled Youth A
going into his room himself without having to be escorted at that
point. She never saw any marks or bruises on Youth A and
2

denied assaulting Youth A. She also denied seeing any other
staff assault Youth A.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed over the phone with DHHS Worker
1 on 11/01/2024. He recalled the incident in question, where he,
Staff 2 and Staff 3 escorted Youth A to his pod after a separate
escalated incident. When they entered the pod, Youth B struck
Youth A without warning, and Supervisor 1 recalled everyone
being caught off guard. Supervisor 1 recalled Youth A trying to
fight back and being restrained and escorted to his
room. Supervisor 1 described Youth A as resisting at this
point. Supervisor 1 believed he never entered Youth A’s room
and could not recall if any other staff did so either. He stated he
never saw a staff member slam Youth A into a wall or his bed.
Staff 2 was interviewed over the phone with DHHS Worker 1 on
11/01/2024. He recalled being called to an escalated situation
with Youth A. His first contact with Youth A was escorting him
back to the pod with Supervisor 1. As they entered the pod Youth
B reached over Staff 2 and attacked Youth A. Staff 2 recalled
turning his attention to Youth B, and then he ended up switching
spots with Supervisor 1 and was with Youth A. Staff 2 recalled
Youth A trying to fight back at Youth B, and he was concerned
that if things escalated Youth A would be injured by Youth B. Staff
2 recalled accidently leaning into the wall while holding Youth A’s
arms behind him, and in doing so he was able to gain more
physical control of the situation. Staff 2 did not believe that Youth
A’s head ever touched the wall, and he denied slamming Youth A
into the wall. Staff 2 escorted Youth A to his bedroom and in the
process Youth A was resisting. Staff 2 then moved Youth A into
his room and Youth A tried to run back out, so he was restrained
again. Staff 2 recalled Youth A dropping his weight and ending up
on the ground on his side while attempting to kick and hit. Staff 2
believed that Supervisor 1 and Staff 3 swapped out with him after
a minute or so, and Youth A was able to reach a level of calm to
end the restraint after that. Staff 2 denied ever having an elbow
on Youth A’s body in any way, and he recalled that Youth A never
made contact with his bed. Staff 2 did not see any bruises or
other visible injuries on Youth A after the incident.
Youth B was interviewed over the phone with DHHS Worker 1 on
11/01/2024. He recalled the incident in question, stating he hit
Youth A because Youth A had been spitting on other youth and
staff. Youth B stated that he himself had to be restrained so he
didn’t see the entire incident, but he did see Youth A get
3

restrained. This some of what occurred in Youth A’s room and did
not believe that Youth A was slammed against a wall or his bed.
Youth C was interviewed over the phone with DHHS Worker 1 on
11/01/2024. He recalled seeing the incident begin when Youth B
swung on Youth A as Youth A entered the pod. Both youths were
then restrained by staff. Youth C stated he was standing in the
open area of the pod and saw much of the incident unfold, and
denied ever seeing Youth A be slammed into a wall or his bed at
any point in time.
Youth D was interviewed over the phone with DHHS Worker 1 on
11/01/2024. Youth D recalled being in the open area of the pod
when Youth A entered with staff, only for Youth B to “sneak
attack” and hit Youth A. Youth D recalled Youth A then trying to
fight back, and staff attempting to restrain him to keep him
back. He believed any aspect of the restraints that he saw were
proper. Youth D saw Youth A have to be taken to his room and
could see inside of his room, and Youth D stated there was no
point where Youth A was slammed on anything or had a staff
member’s elbow on him.
Staff 3 was interviewed with DHHS Worker 1 on 11/20/2024
during a previously announced face-to-face visit. He stated he
was involved in the situation only briefly at the beginning in
assisting in the escort of Youth A back to the pod. He recalled
seeing Youth B hit Youth A upon entrance to the pod but stated he
had to leave the situation shortly thereafter to attend to another
emergent situation elsewhere in the building.
It was reported during a video conference with DHHS Worker 1
on 11/25/2024 that her investigation had not yet been completed
and no results could yet be shared. It was later confirmed that
DHHS Worker 1’s investigation did not produce findings.
Video footage reviewed:
• Facility security camera footage for the incident that
occurred on 10/19/2024 was provided and reviewed. The
footage did not present a perfectly clear representation of
the incident because of some inadvertent glitches. What
could be seen was the immediate aftermath of Youth B
assaulting Youth A upon Youth A entering the pod. Staff
could be seen intervening with Youth B, and at the same
time Staff 2 attempted to restrain Youth A. Staff 2 utilized a
one person restraint hold where he held Youth A’s arms
behind his body. Youth A and Staff 2 came into contact
4

with the wall, but it could not be determined if Youth A’s
face hit the wall as well. Youth A was then escorted to his
room by Staff 2, and it appeared that Youth A resisted and
struggled while this occurred. It was confirmed that no
other camera angle existed that would have provided a
better view inside of Youth A’s room.
Documentation reviewed:
• Incident report documentation dated 10/19/2024 was
provided and reviewed. This document outlined similar
details of the incident as were provided in interviews with
youth and staff.
• Facility medical notes dated 10/19/2024 were provided and
reviewed. In this documentation it was noted that Youth A
stated that he had his face slammed against the wall a few
times near the exit door of the pod. He also stated that he
was taken to his room and his face was slammed against
his bed while being restrained, as well as having a staff
member put their elbow on his face while on the
ground. The nurse that completed the medical
documentation noted that he had a bruise on the front side
of his shoulder. No facial injuries or bruising were noted
and no other injuries were noted.
• Documentation of the facility’s approved restraint model,
MANDT, was provided and reviewed. Of the approved
restraint holds included a one person restraint titled “Two
Arm Hold” where a staff member holds a youths arms from
behind them. This was the hold that Staff 2 was attempting
to place Youth A in at the outset of the video
documentation.
• Facility policy on youth discipline and behavior
management was provided and reviewed. This
documentation outlined prohibited conduct from staff to
youth, including any type of physical discipline.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as per youth and staff
interviews, video footage and other documentation
reviewed. There was no evidence found to show that staff
slammed or pushed Youth A during the incident on 10/19/2024.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
5

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
